moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4
comment: (4... Nd4 used to be Rubinstein's pet line afterwards. )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2
comment: (9. Re1 Nd8 10. d4 c6 11. Bf1 Ne6 12. Bc1 is also played. )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6
comment: The mobility of this knight, which always aims to occupy f4, is the greatest obstacle for white.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6
comment: (13... Nf4? 14. Nd4! exd4 15. Qxf4 dxc3 16. Rae1 intending Qe3 and f4 with a powerful attack is good for white. )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6
comment: (14...Nf4 is still bad because of 15. Nd4 exd4 (Black cannot allow the White knight to occupy f5) 16. Qxf4 dxc3 ( or if 16... g5 17.Bxg5 hxg5 18. Qxg5+ Kh8 19. cxd4 Rfe8 20. Ra5 with attack.) 17. d4 is better for white. )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3
comment: (15. d4 was essential 15... Nf4 (Bad for black is 15... g5 16. Bg3 Nf4 17.Bxf4 gxf4 (17... exf4 18. e5!) 18. g3 Nh5 19. Qe2 with advantage to white.)16. dxe5 dxe5 17. Nd4 Rad8 18.Qe3 exd4 19. Qxf4 g5 20. Bxg5 white obtains advantageous attack.) )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4
comment: (17.Qe3 with the idea of Rad1, Rd2, Red1 might be better. )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6
comment: The White's King side has been weakened and an attack with ...f5 is threatened.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3
comment: intending to reply...f5 with ef and then Nf3-d2-e4 defending f2.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4
comment: The Knight has a good central outpost compensating Black's possession of the f-file but the weakness caused by g3 cramps White considerably.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7
comment: intending...Kh8, Ng8-f6 dislodging the powerful white knight.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1
comment: Increasing the mobility of the queen. But 25. c4? would be a decisive mistake 25...Rh5 intending ...Nf5-d4-f3 when Qh3 is threatened.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1 Kh8

1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1 Kh8 26. c4 Ng8
comment: if now 26... Rh5 white can stop the entry of black's knight by 27. Qf1! Nf5 28. Rf3! and 29. c3 prevents the Black's knight from entering d4.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1 Kh8 26. c4 Ng8 27. f3 Nf6 28. Rf1
comment: if 28. Nc3 then 28... g5 intending...g4)

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1 Kh8 26. c4 Ng8 27. f3 Nf6 28. Rf1 Nxe4 29. Qxe4
comment: it seems that White has overcome his problems of middlegame and has consolidated the position. But Rubinstein's next two moves create fresh problems for White. 29. Rxe4 and 30 Qe3 might be equal.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1 Kh8 26. c4 Ng8 27. f3 Nf6 28. Rf1 Nxe4 29. Qxe4 Qd8 30. Qg4
comment: White tries to prevent ...Qg5. But 30. Ree1 Qb8 (30 ...Qg5!? intending Rf4-d4) 31. Qe3 holds the position.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. comment: Quite overwhelming ! The Queen now takes up a strong position on the Q-wing.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Qe4 Qb4 34. R1e2
comment: It would have been better to maintain the rook on the 1st rank.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. comment: (40. b4 Ra1 41. Rb2 (41. c5 Rd1!) 41... Rd1) 40. c5 was the only chance of counterplay. 40... Ra5 (If 40... Ra3 41. cxd6 cxd6 42. f4 exf4 43. gxf4 Rxf4 44. Re7 Ra2+ 45. Kg3 Rff2 46. Rcc7 Rg2+ 47. Kf3 Raf2+ 48. Ke3 Re2+ 49. Kd3 Rxe7 50. Rxe7 Rxh2 51. Rxb7 threatening ...Rd7with a probable draw.) 41. b4 Ra4 42. b5! threatening 43. b6 cb6 44. c6! )

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. comment: If 44. Kh3 then Rg1 or if 44. c5 Rd1 45. cxb6 cxb6 46. Rc6 b5 and then Rxd5

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bb5 Bb4 5. O-O O-O 6. d3 Bxc3 7. bxc3 d6 8. Bg5 Qe7 9. Qd2 Nd8 10. Bc4 Be6 11. Bb3 Bxb3 12. axb3 Ne6 13. Bh4 h6 14. Rfe1 a6 15. Bg3 Nh5 16. d4 Nef4 17. Bxf4 Nxf4 18. g3 Ng6 19. Qd3 Qe6 20. Nd2 f5 21. d5 Qd7 22. exf5 Rxf5 23. Ne4 Raf8 24. Re3 Ne7 25. Rd1 Kh8 26. c4 Ng8 27. f3 Nf6 28. Rf1 Nxe4 29. Qxe4 Qd8 30. Qg4 Qb8 31. Kg2 Qa7 32. Rfe1 Qc5 33. Qe4 Qb4 34. R1e2 R5f6 35. Qd3 Kg8 36. Qc3 a5 37. Qxb4 axb4 38. c3 bxc3 39. Rxc3 Ra8 40. Kh3 b6 41. Kg4 Ra1 42. Rb2 Kh7 43. b4 Kg6 44. Rbb3 Rf5 45. Rc2 Rh1 46. f4
comment: There is no adequate defence. Either the King is mated or a pawn is lost. (46.h4 h5#) If 46. Kh3 Rh5+ 47. Kg4 R5xh2 48. Rxh2 Rxh2 49. f4 (49. c5? h5#) 49... e4 50. f5+ Kf6 51. Kf4 Rc2 52. Kxe4 Rxc4+ 53. Kd3 53... b5 with a winning position. And if 46. c5 dxc5 (46...Rg5+ 47. Kh3 Rh5+) 47. bxc5 bxc5 48. Rxc5 Rxh2 49. Rc6+ Rf6 50. Rxf6+ gxf6 51. f4 f5+ 52. Kf3 e4+ 53. Ke3 Rg2 is winning.)
